And, really, is there anyone better to learn that pitch from than Koufax? But Koufax has a very special relationship with Pedro Martinez, who met Koufax about 20 years ago when he was a 17-year-old in Dodgertown, up in Vero Beach, for the first time. Pedro spoke about that relationship with us today. Some of it youll see in my story, but Pedro was so fantastic speaking about the subject that it would be unfair for baseball fans not to read more. Heres a chunk of the Q&A with Pedro. Enjoy.

title: More Puzzles From Recent Events
description: Even very strong players are not immune to making fairly basic mistakes, as shown by the first two problems in this set, which come from games in the Aeroflot Open. Endgames are often won with precise play, as seen in the fourth problem. The last problem is not from a game, but rather is based on an actual position and involves a king hunt. In each case, click on the chess board and wait for the viewer to load, then make a move on the chess board by clicking and dragging a piece and wait for the computer to respond. If you get the whole sequence of moves right , the computer will let you know that you succeeded. Hints are available. Enjoy!

title: Independent Spirits: On the Beach, Under the Wire
description: The Bagger took his dune buggy down the hill to Santa Monica and has pulled up to the Independent Spirit Awards, the annual hoedown dedicated to independent film. Just after the talent finally made their way in, the rain came. The year, Rainn Wilson (Dwight on The Office) is hosting the event and said he works in something called television, a device that Indywood dont much about, along with the people who enjoy it.

title: Deconstructing an Obama Victory
description: Heres further grist for the mill for anyone deconstructing how Senator Hillary Clinton lost so many states to Senator Barack Obama.

title: Sundays Breakfast Menu, Feb. 24
description: Senator John McCain has said he does not intend to discuss it further, but his top advisers are likely not finished talking about a New York Times article examining his ties to a lobbyist on Sundays news shows. Charlie Black, a top strategist, is slated for CBSs Face the Nation, Robert Bennett, his lawyer dealing with this matter, is on CNNs Late Edition, and Rick Davis, the campaign manager, is on Fox News Sunday.

title: Independent Spirits: Shes Right There
description: Best supporting female went to Cate Blanchett, who is very much with child, for her inhabitation of Bob Dylan. After taking a while to get up to the podium, she said, Its not polite to make a pregnant lady waddle that far.

title: Wonderful World of Color
description: Children of all ages are hooked on pink and blue, a trend ensured by parents who begin collecting for sons and daughters when they are infants.

title: Independent Spirits: Yelling Cut on the Cut-Up
description: A series of fake auditions by Rainn Wilson with the real directors  Julian Schnabel and Todd Haynes so far  have been over the top hilarious. Wilson, who has made a fine career out of acting the fool on The Office, is knocking them dead at the Spirits. His audition as Bob Dylan had people choking on their blow-dried chicken entre.

title: Getting Ready for Tip-off in Memphis
description: MEMPHIS  Its a sunny Saturday here, and the streets around the downtown are already buzzing for the big No. 1 vs. No. 2 game tonight between Memphis and Tennessee.

title: Independent Spirits: A Savage Love
description: Philip Seymour Hoffman, who won for best male lead, said that he felt as if he had gained two sisters in making The Savages. The sublime Laura Linney, speaking for many in mentioning his co-star, and director Tamara Jenkins.

title: Back in Buffalo
description: The Rangers game tonight in Buffalo not only brings the team back to the site of their moment of defeat to the Sabres in last years playoffs, but also brings the architect of that defeat  then-Sabres captain Chris Drury  back here as well.

title: Independent Spirits: June Bug Goes Big
description: Ellen Page seemed actually surprised she won best actress  no one else was  and she said this is pretty much all Diablo Codys fault. She wrote one of the best screenplays I have ever read.

title: Showing Up Late for Spring Training
description: The Yankees pitchers and catchers reported to spring training on Feb. 14, and the rest of the squad showed up a few days later. Yet Im just now flying to Tampa.

title: Clinton Offers Regrets for Spouses Remarks
description: NEW ORLEANS  Appearing before a predominantly black audience here Saturday afternoon, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton defended her husbands legacy on race relations and offered an apology of sorts for comments he made in South Carolina several weeks ago that many people viewed as racially insensitive.

title: Star Gazing at FedEx Forum
description: MEMPHIS  This game between Memphis and Tennessee has been a fascinating portrait of just how much the country cares about college basketball. While we wont find out until the ratings come out if Memphis and Tennessee moves the television needle, it certainly has attracted an unusual blend of celebrities.

title: The Romance of Family
description: Like Frank quoting Marsha, I too didnt quite buy that the Mother needed comforting at the end. Also, like Frank, I wanted more of a catharsis and for Violet to have a last moment in communion with her existential terror.

title: Highs and Lows in the Record Books
description: Memphis and Tennessee might be the talk of college basketball today, but this was significant day for two other teams  for vastly different reasons. Let us consider the fates of Bentley College and the New Jersey Institute of Technology, which were each featured in articles by The Times last month (here and here).

title: Lifting Spirits
description: There are those, count the Bagger among them, who think the 08 season could use a lift. And it arrived the day before the Oscars: a wrasslin match occurred on Santa Monica beach that seemed to indicate that one way or another, all will be well.

title: U.S. Defense Chief and Australians Insist Alliance Is Strong
description: CANBERRA, Australia  Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates and top Australian officials insisted Saturday that the security alliance between the United States and Australia had not frayed despite Australias recent pledge to remove all combat forces from Iraq.

title: Power Play
description: Theres a school of style slut (and Ill own up to being a member) that likes to believe changes in fashion reflect broader shifts in society, geopolitics, the arts, the economy and so on. Maybe it makes us feel less guilty about spending quite so much time and money on what we wear, or perhaps it gives us an excuse to talk about it longer.

title: Now Swapping | Musical Ensembles
description: Swap-a-rama Razzmatazz is one of Londons most fashionable club nights  and certainly its most eccentric. Its origins date to the time when a chap named Alex Collins studied abroad and lived on a commune where many garments were communal property. Eager to recreate back home that year of my life when not having possessions didnt bother me, Collins held a party at which guests were told to swap outfits every time a whistle blew. The mayhem inspired Eloise Markwell-Butler, Dean Slydell, Dani Mazzer and Nick Frew to take the concept public, aided by donations from the vintage megastore Beyond Retro. Swap-a-rama Razzmatazz is now held at Favela Chic in the Shoreditch neighborhood once every month. Clotheslines festoon the club, and when the klaxon sounds, you either swap or split: ogling bystanders are evicted. Markwell-Butler likens it to being in a mad persons laundry. Since partygoers keep their booty, at 3 for admission, its Londons cheapest way to get a new wardrobe. [?][?][?]SARAH NIR

title: An Approach to Cuba
description: To the Editor:

title: Kill and Be Killed
description: Peter Robinson is a good, gray writer who, while lacking a dazzling literary style, brings much sober intelligence and technical skill to the plotting of his police procedural series featuring Detective Chief Inspector Alan Banks and various colleagues in the Eastvale constabulary. While all that well-hammered craftsmanship can feel a bit leaden, Robinson always tells a dandy story. And when he chooses  to challenge himself or merely to sate the current publishing appetite for supersized mysteries with bloated plots  he can even tell two stories at once, as is the case in FRIEND OF THE DEVIL (Morrow, $24.95).

title: Goddess in the Details
description: This is the Year of the Goddess, judging by the clothes that designers sent down the runway. So much for the sirens: they had their day, and now theyre tired; some are in rehab. More preferable, as archetypes go, is the goddess, with her ancient Grecian pedigree, her aloof demeanor suggesting self-possession and powers of divine intervention, her sensuous revelry in her own body. The goddess ratchets our standards considerably higher where sex is concerned: only gods need apply.

title: Now Burying | Outdated Jewelry
description: Who says breaking up cant be fun? Say I dont and you can attend

title: Coverage of the Mideast Conflict
description: To the Editor:

title: Big Wheels for Iraqs Mean Streets
description: ON the first day of his third deployment to Iraq, Marine Staff Sgt. Christopher Spurlock was traveling in a convoy that was helping to clear roadside bombs in Ramadi. Sergeant Spurlock was riding in an armored transport known as an MRAP, and his vehicle, a Cougar, was fourth or fifth in line.

title: LHeir du Temps
description: If youre in Paris and you want to see Ingress 1862 masterpiece, Le Bain Turc, or his earlier flirtation with neo-Classicism in Oedipus Explaining the Enigma of the Sphinx, or the Greek Classicism that inspired it, you can take the Mtro to an art museum called the Louvre. If you want to smell the original 1966 Aramis, which descended from the 1944 Bandit, which itself was built on the principles of Fougre Royale created for the house of Houbigant in 1884, you can take the RER to another Paris art museum: the Osmothque, at 36 rue du Parc-de-Clagny.

title: A Country Music Veteran Proves Hes No Mere Hat Act
description: NASHVILLE

title: Putins Iron Grip on Russia Suffocates Opponents
description: NIZHNY NOVGOROD, Russia  Shortly before parliamentary elections in December, foremen fanned out across the sprawling GAZ vehicle factory here, pulling aside assembly-line workers and giving them an order: vote for President Vladimir V. Putins party or else. They were instructed to phone in after they left their polling places. Names would be tallied, defiance punished.

title: Stefani Zaidman and Michael Ash
description: Stefani Lauren Zaidman, a daughter of Susan and Louis Zaidman of Manalapan, N.J., was married on Saturday evening to Michael Jared Ash, a son of Sharon and Abraham Ash of Monroe, N.J. Rabbi Ira J. Rothstein performed the ceremony at Temple Emanu-El in Closter, N.J.

title: Pink Is for ...
description: THE inspiration for JeongMee Yoons photographic project was her 5-year-old daughter, Seowoo, who loved things pink. As a setting for a portrait, Ms. Yoon assembled all of her daughters pink possessions  stuffed animals, dolls, plastic toys, books, clothes, jewelry, makeup and school supplies  into an orderly display. Seowoos bedroom was transformed into a pink kingdom for a child queen.

title: Looking for Music, but Not Celebration, to Remember Castro? Put the Radio On
description: JERSEY CITY

title: Correction: Essay
description: An essay on Feb. 10 about F. Scott Fitzgeralds Pat Hobby stories added a word to the title of one of Fitzgeralds novels. It is The Beautiful and Damned, not the Damned.

title: Closed Kingdom Cracks a Door Open
description: IF you were running a restrictive Islamic state where the women cant drive and restaurants are segregated between families and single men, the last idea that might occur to you is to invite Westerners in to have a look. And yet, thats exactly what the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is doing.

title: Imagination Business Begins at Home
description: NOT so long ago, all you had to do to show disdain for something was to look bored and say, Oh ... its so derivative.

title: Jeepers Peepers!
description: American culture has long fetishized the eyelash. Designed by nature to be the simple shrubbery that protects the cornea from dust and small particles, the humble strip of cilia has evolved into an object of sensual fascination, aesthetic peacockery and, most recently, federal concern of such magnitude that the F.D.A. and a squadron of marshals were forced to intervene.

title: With Simple Tools, an Expression of Fragility and Humanity
description: An abbreviated list of materials used in Fred Hollands exhibition at the Amelie A. Wallace Gallery includes yams, wax, gold leaf, honey, soap, water, dirt and electricity. A sculptor and conceptual artist, Mr. Holland has turned the three large galleries here into a seductively cryptic meditation on impermanence, fragility and regeneration.

title: Hey, Humvee, Move Over: Driving an MRAP
description: MRAPS are indeed huge and ungainly, but they have a surprisingly supple ride and are quick when they have to be. Although I could not imagine maneuvering them through narrow Iraqi streets, they perform well on the open road.

title: In Two Minutes, Devils Get Upper Hand on Islanders
description: NEWARK  Islanders goaltender Rick DiPietro kept his helmet on just in case, but he finished Saturdays game against the Devils on the bench, replaced by an extra skater. His mastery over the Devils had been undone by a third-period onslaught.

title: House Weighing Independent Ethics Panel
description: WASHINGTON  Days after another member of Congress was charged in a broad criminal indictment, the House is set to consider the creation of an independent ethics panel that supporters hope will restore credibility to efforts to police Congress internally.

title: Margiela ... Ela ... Ela ...
description: The hodgepodge of fabrics stitched together by MARC JACOBS this spring recalled Margielas early experiments with deconstruction and layering.

title: A College Basketball Fan Finds Order Courtside
description: Ned Hirsch has made more court appearances than most other lawyers over the past 38 years.

title: Combine and Conquer
description: IN some segments of the real estate market, much bigger is much better. Just ask Donald J. Trump.

title: Confronting a Wave of Foreclosures
description: WITH more than 20,000 subprime mortgages in Connecticut scheduled to reset to higher interest rates over the next two years, the wave of foreclosures currently flooding court dockets throughout the state represents the early stages of what could be a protracted deluge. While foreclosures are up all over the state, the region hit hardest so far is New Haven County.

title: Bridgeport Mayors Wish: Selling City Hall
description: Bridgeport

title: Obamas Kenyan Roots
description: KOGELO, Kenya

title: Events in Westchester
description: Comedy

title: Once Pure White, American Classics Cross a Color Line
description: THEATER people have been talking for decades about James Earl Jones playing Big Daddy. The established white Southern setting of Tennessee Williamss Cat on a Hot Tin Roof notwithstanding, Mr. Jones, the barrel-chested actor with the inimitable basso profundo, strikes many as a natural fit for the foul-tempered, vulgar landowner. There was serious discussion about building a production of the play around him back in 1987, and when the producer Stephen Byrd approached him about the part in the mid-90s, Mr. Jones told him, I always wanted to play that cracker.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Pettitte, for Better or Worse

title: Confronting a Wave of Foreclosures
description: WITH more than 20,000 subprime mortgages in Connecticut scheduled to reset to higher interest rates over the next two years, the wave of foreclosures currently flooding court dockets throughout the state represent the early stages of what could be a protracted deluge. While foreclosures are up all over the state, the region hit hardest so far is New Haven County.

title: Correction: To Have and Give Not
description: A map with an article on Feb. 10 about an expansion of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art included an outdated name for one of the buildings on the museums campus. The building next to the Bing Center is the Art of the Americas Building, not the Modern and Contemporary Art Building.

title: My Life in Pictures
description: 1977 Me as Ingress La Grande Odalisque. Those are my mothers wedding sheets.

title: A Real Estate Sequel
description: DANIEL RADCLIFFE, the actor who played Harry Potter in five movies (and counting), is starring in another sequel, this one set in the bottomless excesses of the Manhattan luxury market.

title: Quin Es Less Macho?
description: If this is truly the Decline and Fall of the Clinton Empire, it is marked by one freaky stroke of bad luck and one striking historical irony.

title: A Kingdom in the Mountains Shares Its Secrets
description: WHEN American curators arrived one spring morning at Norbugang Yu Lhakang, a Buddhist temple in a remote village in western Bhutan, they found a group of monks sitting on the floor in bright robes, chanting. They had been there since 6 a.m., intent on creating the right ambience for a divination ceremony.

title: Courtney Coles, Jonathan Evans
description: Courtney Elizabeth Coles, a daughter of Maryellen Coles and Julian R. Coles of Cape Elizabeth, Me., was married on Saturday to Jonathan Perry Evans, the son of Constance F. Tierney of New York and Robert S. Evans of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Suzanne Meyer, a Unitarian minister, officiated at La Playa Beach & Golf Resort in Naples, Fla.

title: The Plaza to Reopen After $400 Million Face-Lift
description: The Eloise of the new millennium should be thrilled to return to her beloved Plaza, which after two years and a $400 million renovation, is set to reopen March 1. The hotel has maintained its Old World grandeur by redressing 282 guest rooms and suites with custom-made furnishings and furniture  la Louis XV, while it has simultaneously entered the modern age with touch-screen AMX Systems in each room that control the temperature and lighting and put guests in direct contact with concierge services. Eloise would also be impressed with the hotel-wide wireless Internet access, flat-screen televisions, 24-karat gold-plated bathroom faucets and white-glove butler service. The Plaza will have 35,000 square feet of meeting space (including an upgraded Grand Ballroom and Terrace Room), and high-end shopping at the Plaza Retail Collection, which will also house a spa, salon, and fitness center. There will also be two new elegant watering holes: a champagne bar in the lobby and the Rose Club, which will serve signature cocktails. Nightly rates start at $1,000 (www.theplaza.com).

title: Off-Road, and Off-Limits
description: CHATSWORTH, N.J.

title: Big Hat Millie and Other Reminders of a Vanishing Past
description: THE last time Camille Taylor caught a whiff of fame was more than 60 years ago on the stage of the Apollo Theater in Harlem. Back then, Ms. Taylor was a spunky young woman who had moved to New York from Charlotte, N.C., and edged her way onto the black vaudeville circuit. Her stage name was Big Hat Millie, a nod to the wide-brimmed hats she favored.

title: For Bookshop, the Writing Is Fading
description: HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON

title: You Hate His Toll Plan; Ready for His Budget?
description: TRENTON  His grand plan to save New Jersey from fiscal purgatory is in tatters. More residents than ever before are unhappy with him. And things are unlikely to get better anytime soon.

title: How to Date a Video Gamer
description: The first time Miho Walsh visited Roy Priebs New York apartment in 2003, she spent three hours watching him and his roommates play the video game Splinter Cell. I got a good sense of what Roy likes to do in his spare time, Ms. Walsh said.

title: Frill Seekers
description: Who needs television writers when youve got big-city housewives willing to bare all? The women who star in Real Housewives of New York City, which premieres on Bravo on March 4, recently provided enough material for a novel, but a thousand words will have to suffice.

title: Echoes of Amado in the Dark and the Light
description: IN Portuguese, amado means beloved, and in more than a score of novels, the Brazilian writer Jorge Amado made clear his eternal passion for Salvador da Bahia, the city that took him in as a teenage boarding student and became his home. Salvador, in turn, loved him back, and even now, more than six years after his death, Amados exuberant spirit, aesthetic and characters seem to permeate the streets of the place he described both as the most mysterious and beautiful of the worlds cities and the most languid of women.

title: Susannah Foster, Kenyon Weaver
description: Susannah Landes Foster, a daughter of Jane L. Foster and Edward I. Foster of Merion Station, Pa., was married on Saturday evening to Kenyon Sean Matthew Weaver, a son of Jacqueline L. Weaver and Kirk K. Weaver of Houston. Rabbi Vivian E. Schirn officiated at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts in Philadelphia.

title: Now Buying | Guerrilla-girl Bags
description: The latest addition to the fashion worlds motley crew of multitaskers is a group of drug guerrillas turned handbag designers. Not to be confused with the feminist art gang the Guerrilla Girls or Comme des Garons temporary guerrilla stores, these unlikely artisans work with Egg, a Bogot-based nonprofit organization that is teaching reformed Colombian rebels how to make crocodile totes. Currently, a battery of 20-something men  all from the Antioquia region, where the Colombian armed conflict still has legs  learn construction techniques from native craftsmen. Theyre fiercely dedicated to their work, says Claudia Gaitn de Caballero, Eggs co-director. And its a great way for them to become regular citizens. The bags, which have been picked up by decidedly imperialist institutions like New Yorks Takashimaya and Saks Fifth Avenue Mexico, retail for about $1,300. [?][?][?]SUSAN CERNE

title: The Greek Ideal
description: Aphrodite, goddess of desire and beauty.

title: Tristram, Tom and Gulliver
description: To the Editor:

title: A Peek Behind North Koreas Iron Curtain
description: The Berlin Wall might be a thing of the past, but the demilitarized zone between North and South Korea  the worlds most heavily armed border  is still a modern-day phenomenon. Americans whod like to take a peek behind North Koreas Iron Curtain, including the zone have a chance to do so this fall with two tours offered by Snow Lion Expeditions (www.snowlion.com), a Salt Lake City-based travel company. We have a crack in the door for Americans to get in, said Steve Pastorino, vice president of marketing for the company, who has found a way to procure visas for Americans through a partnership with Koryo, a British consortium of documentary filmmakers and tour guides who work regularly in North Korea. The 11-day tours visit both North and South Korea, using Beijing as a home base. Highlights of the itinerary include attending the Mass Games, a color-coded, athletic performance organized by the state, and visiting sites like Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the mausoleum of Kim Il-Sung. The trip starts at $5,895, including guides, lodging, meals and admission  but not flights.

title: New Group Chooses Its First Battle, Asthma
description: GWENDOLYN STRETCH, the medical director at the Elsie Owens North Brookhaven Health Center, in Coram, had a lot to do during the 20-minute appointment with her next patient. After examining Nelia McPherson, 44, a chronic asthma patient from East Patchogue, Dr. Stretch renewed prescriptions and discussed some of the risks that could trigger an asthma attack  including rugs and plastic covers on mattresses. Atop the doctors priority list was to encourage her patient to stop smoking.

title: Weight Watchers
description: Theyre not just slimming: when priced by the pound, this seasons most diaphanous dresses might make you lightheaded. [?][?][?]ARMAND LIMNANDER

title: Poet-Soldiers Lend Voices on Iraq War
description: Teaneck

title: The Illusionist
description: Steven Millhauser doesnt traffic in emotional upheaval or interpersonal conflict. Most fiction writers try to make characters seem like real people, but Millhauser flattens them, giving his books the paradoxical effect of seeming realer than reality. For him, meticulous observation does the work of psychology. Millhauser is also our foremost animist: in his stories, mannequins walk out of department store windows and figures in paintings knock hats off innocent bystanders. His vehicles for these effects are the parable and the confession. There is a disquieting quiet to every Millhauser sentence that makes it immediately recognizable, a feeling that each was recorded for posterity by the last man living.

title: Pirates New Management Team Asks Fans to Hope Against Hope
description: BRADENTON, Fla.  Frank Coonelly, the new president of the Pittsburgh Pirates, was soaking up the sounds of bat cracking ball and ball popping leather on Thursday when a fan pierced the paradise.

title: At 17, a Folk Artist on the Rise
description: Croton-on-Hudson

title: Whats My line?
description: Plays the thing for this seasons dress rehearsal. The starlet MariaCarla Boscono bones up.

title: Primary Sources
description: David McCullough, the best-selling historian, insists that the secret to his craft is simple: tell stories. If we say, The king died and then the queen died, we have two events. If we add that the queen died of grief, we have a story, and a good one because the reader has a reason to care. This maxim (McCullough borrowed it from E. M. Forster) is less helpful when theres no royal paper trail. Can history assume the queens grief because it makes a good story? A good story may stand in for a true one.

title: Baby Steps
description: The model Liya Kebede has made great strides for racial diversity in fashion (see her in Toga Land, Page 236). Now, shes starting Lemlem, a mostly hand-woven line of childrens clothes made in Africa, in the hope that a younger crowd will embrace her multi-culti ideals. The name means to bloom,  says Kebede, who on a visit to her native Ethiopia met talented weavers struggling to survive. I wanted to help preserve their art while creating job opportunities. The outfits, at Scoop and Barneys New York, have an Ethiopian vibe with a New World ease. Finicky tots will approve. [?][?][?]ARMAND LIMNANDER

title: A Run for Governor, Rough Edges Included
description: An article last Sunday about James A. Amann, the speaker of Connecticuts legislature, who is exploring a run for governor, misstated the surname of the winner of Connecticuts 2006 Democratic primary for the United States Senate. It is Ned Lamont, not Lamott.

title: Boston Has High Hopes Now That the Dig Is Done
description: BOSTON  In the gloom of winter, it is hard to see potential amid the strips of brown grass and pavement that lie where this citys hulking elevated highway used to be.

title: Teamworks Rewards
description: I WAS born with social activism in my DNA. My grandfather was a union organizer in the garment district in New York City. My mother took me to a civil rights demonstration in Washington in my stroller. My father was worried that Id be the youngest person to have a photograph in an F.B.I. file.

title: Dont Go There
description: As the author of more than 20 contentious volumes of criticism, George Steiner hasnt exactly been one to hold back. Yet some projects have been too sensitive, difficult or doomed for him to undertake. His new collection of essays, My Unwritten Books, offers blueprints and eulogies for seven books he says hell never write, on topics including his Jewish identity, teaching, animals and politics. These essays are not imaginary CliffsNotes; they stand alone and reveal Steiner at his most complex: irascible and passionate, erudite and self-absorbed, determined to engage the most difficult cultural problems. His lyric fury is sharpest in School Terms, in which he surveys educational practices across the globe  then takes a flamethrower to them. Steiner, who taught at a string of top institutions before settling down at Harvard, then Cambridge, ultimately proposes an bersyllabus that would gorge us on the worlds diverse knowledge.

title: Correction: In Miami, the Beach Party Moves Indoors
description: An article on Feb. 3 about the art scene in Miami misspelled the name of a collector and real estate developer in one reference. He is Craig Robins, not Robbins.

title: A Silken Mountain of Forgery
description: IN 1957 the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, snagged what appeared to be a rare masterpiece by the 10th-century Chinese painter Guan Tong. Not only was Drinking and Singing at the Foot of a Precipitous Mountain a spectacular example of the monumental landscape tradition  a view of cloud-dappled peaks, densely forested slopes and swirling waters  but the paintings pedigree also seemed impeccable. Inscriptions on the worn, fragile silk indicated that through the centuries it had been among the treasured possessions of princes, emperors and connoisseurs. The latest of those collectors was Zhang Daqian, then in his 50s, one of the pre-eminent authorities on Chinese art and a renowned painter in his own right.

title: Correction: The Power of Whimsy
description: An article last Sunday about Sandra Boynton, the childrens book author and greeting card creator, quoted incorrectly the final part of a passage from her book Barnyard Dance! It is Bow to the horse. Bow to the cow. Twirl with the pig if you know how, not Bow to the horse if you know how.

title: Public Broadcasting: Yes, Its Necessary
description: To the Editor:

title: Vaccinating Boys for Girls Sake?
description: HOW cool are those Gardasil Girls? Riding horses, flinging softballs, bashing away on drum sets: on the television commercials, they are pugnacious and utterly winning. They want to be One Less, they chant  one less victim of cervical cancer. Get vaccinated with Gardasil, they urge their sisters. Protect yourselves against the human papillomavirus, or H.P.V., which causes cervical cancer.

title: Letters
description: One Presidents Impact

title: Profane Poet
description: The apotheosis of David Mamet comes near the start of the movie version of Glengarry Glen Ross. Alec Baldwin  hair slicked back, pocket square peaking just so  unleashes a furious, seven-minute tirade against some underperforming real estate salesmen. First prize is a Cadillac Eldorado, he says of a sadistic new contest to increase business. Second prize is a set of steak knives. ... Third prize is youre fired. After insulting his listeners manhood, competence and just about every other attribute that can be impugned with a well-aimed profanity, Baldwin caps the presentation by extracting from his briefcase and brandishing a pair of huge brass balls.

title: Upheaval Over Kosovos Independence Echoes in a New York Enclave
description: For Serbian-Americans, the news from their home country continues to be bad.

title: Elusive Equality
description: In 2006, New Jerseys Supreme Court declared that same-sex couples must be guaranteed all the rights and benefits that come with marriage, but left it to the State Legislature to figure out how. Instead of simply granting gay people the right to marry, the Legislature joined Vermont and Connecticut in creating a lesser category, civil unions. Predictably, civil unions are proving to be an inadequate remedy.

title: In Pursuit of Brittens Hated Outsider
description: THE game is constantly afoot in Benjamin Brittens Peter Grimes. Everyone, it seems, is hunting for something or someone in this opera, most spectacularly in the third and last act, when the entire little fishing community on the harsh North Sea coast of England transforms itself into a vicious mob on the track of Grimes himself, the borough criminal who must be caught and destroyed. One of the most terrifying scenes in opera, it is likely to chill audiences once more when the Metropolitan Opera unveils its new staging on Thursday evening. This is the companys third production since it introduced this compelling work in 1948, just three years after the world premiere at the Sadlers Wells Opera in London.

title: On Air, a Broadcaster and a Killer Shared a Platform
description: Larry Davis, the notorious Bronx killer who was stabbed to death in prison last week, was effectively cut off from the outside world when he was sentenced for murder in 1991. But during his years of incarceration, he found a way to reach beyond his prison bars.

title: Not Too Late for a Dash to the Games
description: ITS not too late to plan a trip to the Beijing Olympics. Sure, more than a million visitors are expected to visit during the Summer Games this August, and most tourist hotels are booked solid. But procrastinators can still chase Olympic gold if theyre willing to be flexible, spend a little more money and perhaps blend in with the locals.

title: Beginners Greek
description: For its entire history, the firm of Beeche and Company, which could trace its origins to New Amsterdam, had engaged solely in one commercial activity: trading. At no time had it cultivated or mined or manufactured any good; it acted, rather, as merchant, factor, broker, financier. At its beginnings, it imported the axes that it traded for wampum, which it traded for beaver skins, which it sold for export. Later on, it bought corn and wheat from the farms of the north and sent its ships laden with them to the Caribbean, where they exchanged their cargo for sugar, rum, molasses, and indigo, which, on the ships' return, Beeche re-exported to the east and west; sometimes, the eastbound ships, after first calling in Britain or France, traveled down to the African coast and then sailed back across the Atlantic with cargo that was human. Beeche was among the first in New York to trade commercial and government paper, and as the years passed it added the securities of banks, then of railroads, then of manufacturers, to its repertoire. By the turn of the last century the firm had grown into a large financial enterprise with thousands of employees, branches throughout the world, and a dozen divisions. Yet its basic business remained the same: trading for its own benefit and brokering the trades of others. No Beeche had touched a plow or a hammer for centuries, nor had he employed anyone who did.

title: A New President for a Diverse Board of Rabbis
description: Merrick

title: From the New Deal, a Way Out of a Mess
description: THE question of the day seems to be this: Are we in, or heading for, a recession? But so much attention is focused on that question that we may be losing sight of an even greater danger: the possibility that powerful headwinds may prevent a strong recovery from any slowdown.

title: Certifiably Chic
description: Insanity. The style industry loves it. And why not? Fashion itself

title: Paperback Row
description: THE WELSH GIRL, by Peter Ho Davies. (Mariner/Houghton Mifflin, $13.95.) The lives of three people intersect in a town in northern Wales during World War II: a sheep farmers pregnant daughter who yearns for bigger things, a young German prisoner of war imprisoned in a camp near the town and a half-Jewish German who interrogates prisoners for the British. Daviess first novel is a kaleidoscopic study of the clash ... between personal history and history as it plays out on the world stage, Jennifer Egan wrote in the Book Review.

title: A Public-Office Pay Gap
description: IN the suburbs, real estate, trusted help and income matter, even for the county legislators.

title: Retracing the Elusive Footsteps of a Secretive History
description: ONE balmy day last April, an art and architecture historian named Fern Luskin hauled her laptop and a collapsible chair up to the roof of the Chelsea town house where she lives to work outside for a while. From the top of her building, on West 29th Street near Eighth Avenue, the view to the south is dominated by the bulky towers of the Penn South apartment complex. To the northeast, the Empire State Building pierces the sky.

title: In an Era of the Beatles, the Shags Ruled, Too
description: PUT the words Connecticut and garage together, and most people see visions of weed whackers and garden hoses, not long-haired guys with guitars.

title: You Want Pasta, Weve Got Pasta
description: Fratelli Market is not the sort of Italian place that carries more types of cheeses and dry-cured sausage than you can shake a pepperoni stick at. Its specialty is pasta, particularly ravioli, with so many choices you may take to shopping there week after week.

title: Slavs to Fashion
description: On a recent trip to Moscow, I heard about a fancy Faberg egg being sold for $18.5 million. The news came across as I was looking out a hotel window at the ugliest, most stolid gray building you could find from the Soviet era.

title: Cancer Support Groups
description: To the Editor:

title: A Practice That Goes Way Past Cats and Dogs
description: WHITE PLAINS

title: As Goals Decline, Calls for Change Increase
description: N.H.L. general managers took a big step last week toward ending the goal drought that has afflicted their league for more than a decade, voting unanimously to push for the downsizing of overgrown goalie equipment.

title: Faces From the Screen, Now Life Size
description: ONE man has a dead horse, another a crumbling career; then there is a woman who is among literatures most manipulative. We can only guess at how strong the productions that will bring us these characters might be, but its a sure thing that the actors who portray them are fascinating to watch.

title: Janes Addiction
description: Its mid-December, and Jane Holzer has a chill. Maybe its just the weather, or maybe the 60-something socialite and Warhol superstar turned real estate developer and art collector stayed too long on a construction site. (These days, Holzer buys, renovates and sells town houses.) Anyway, shes frozen, so shes snuggled in her bed, fully dressed in a black long-sleeved top and pants, conducting an interview. You dont mind if we do this here? Holzer asks. One of Andy Warhols Mao paintings hangs above her head; nearby hang some of his flower paintings. A nude by Tom Wesselmann adorns another wall. Furniture by 20th-century design heavyweights like John Dickinson, Samuel Marx and Alessandro Albrizzi fills the space. But of course the most riveting thing in the room is Holzer herself, whom we persist in knowing as Baby Jane Holzer, even though, as she told The Times several years ago, When I introduce myself at a bankers meeting, do you think I introduce myself as Baby Jane? The old hallmarks still rivet, though: those big eyes, that infectious enthusiasm and, of course, that hair. The gorgeous blond hair that, in part, prompted Warhol to stop Holzer in front of Bloomingdales in the 1960s and ask if she wanted to be in the movies. (Sure, she replied. Anything beats being a Park Avenue housewife!) The hair that Irving Penn immortalized in his 1964 Vogue portrait. The hair that Tom Wolfe, in The Girl of the Year, his 1964 essay about Holzer, called an incredible mane, a vast tawny corona. Its still major, and it crowns a very brainy head.

title: With Chamberlain Around, Yanks Find Little Peace
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Joba Chamberlain recently tried to involve his fellow pitcher Mike Mussina in some postpractice recreation in the Yankees clubhouse.

title: Lacroix, Sweetie
description: As a child in southern Provence, Christian Lacroix, the master of maximalist chic, would haunt a small museum filled with dusty wax tableaus illustrating the Spanish influence on local costumes and customs. He decided then that he would be a museum curator, but life had other plans. With the opening last November of a retrospective celebrating the 20th anniversary of his couture house, curated by Lacroix himself, that long-held ambition was finally realized.

title: Any Given Monday
description: FOR New York basketball fans, 33 is either a famous or an infamous number, depending on your age. If youre over 20, you can probably remember when the Knicks were ruled by Patrick Ewing, the dominant center with a blazing 33 on his chest.

title: Troop Leader
description: As the governor of Texas, do you feel it is getting a little crowded there lately as the presidential candidates and their busloads of campaigners continue to descend in preparation for the primary on March 4? We tried to move our primary up, and it didnt work. This is a very rare occurrence, to have a primary of national import in Texas.

title: Elaine Riano and Gregory Brevetti
description: Elaine Riano and Dr. Gregory R. Brevetti were married on Friday. C. Mara Luisa Gonzlez Castro, the municipal director of the civil registry of San Jos del Cabo, Mexico, officiated at the One & Only Palmilla, a resort there. Afterward, Marco Archiga, a Universal Life minister, led a nondenominational ceremony in the same location.

title: For Rowland, Second Chance of a Lifetime
description: Waterbury

title: Renovation Plans Proceeding for Theater
description: Pelham

title: Missile Strike by Israelis in Gaza Kills 3 Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  Three Palestinians were killed in an Israeli Army missile strike in the northern Gaza Strip on Saturday afternoon, Palestinian medical officials said. It was not immediately clear whether those killed were civilians or combatants.

title: Oh, Just Lighten Up and Enjoy the Show
description: SOMETIME on Sunday the subject of the Oscar broadcast will come up at your house or among your friends  perhaps it already has  and a screed against the national parade float that is the Academy Awards will commence.

title: Heel, Girl!
description: In this season of intolerably high, architectonic (indeed, it might be said, misogynistic) heels, heels that look like a childs Lego tower and defy spatial logistics, it behooves me to confess that I have never been able to wear heels higher than two and a half inches, three inches max. I have tried, Lord knows, Ive tried. Who, after all, hasnt been drawn to the invincible come-hitherness of stilettos, the way they announce your sexuality before youve so much as hit the pavement, accentuating the lithe, curvy line of a leg or the sinuous thrust of your hips? I envy friends who are able to glide freely in them, as though they were walking on air, giving off a these-boots-are-made-for-walking insouciance as they sail through the world. Me, I totter forward like a toddler learning to walk or weave from side to side like an old drunk.

title: Letters: Man Bites Insect
description: For those interested in further entomophagous literature, there is the 19th-century classic, Why Not Eat Insects? by Vincent Holt. Particularly apropos of Sam Nejames (Feb. 10) conclusion  Why douse fields with pesticides if the bugs we kill are more nutritious than the crops they eat?  the quotation on the title page of Holts volume reads, Them insecs (sic) eats up every blessed green thing that do grow, and us farmers starves./Well, eat them, and grow fat! The book ends with examples of dinner menus in French and English (choufleurs garnies des chenilles: cauliflower garnished with caterpillars).

title: In the Basement, Deeper Answers About You
description: THE distant Eek! from the basement was startling, though it didnt cause me to panic. The tone signaled that my wife, who was doing laundry at the time, wasnt in any imminent danger. I could tell shed experienced some kind of shock, however.

title: Now Shopping | Gucci Trumps Manhattan
description: No one can ever accuse Gucci of doing things halfheartedly. For the opening of its largest boutique in the world  a 46,000-square-foot gold-and-glass extravaganza in Manhattans Trump Tower  Madonna and the Gucci creative director, Frida Giannini, held a star-studded fund-raiser on the north lawn of the United Nations to benefit Unicef and Raising Malawi. But those looking to combine their altruism with a little swag need not have worried  Giannini also designed two bag collections for the occasion: Heritage (left) plays up Guccis history with a rendition of a print from the 1950s, while New York Exclusive pays tribute to the Big Apple, with all proceeds benefiting the Central Park playgrounds. [?][?][?]LEE CARTER

title: Working All Corners in a Global Talent Hunt
description: MALTE VON PUTBUS has a mission. As global recruitment manager for the International Finance Corporation, the investment banking arm of the World Bank, he oversees efforts to find new employees around the world.

title: Riders for Slipstream Are Gaining Notice
description: SANTA CLARITA, Calif.  Even before many of his riders had set out on Fridays time trial at the Tour of California, Jonathan Vaughters, the sports director of the Slipstream-Chipotle team, could not help looking ahead to the final two days of the Tour.

title: Prisoner of the Palace
description: Royal families and imperial dynasties are by nature closed and hidden. Unless they can maintain their mystique in this democratic age, they have little reason to exist. Queen Elizabeth II does not give interviews and neither do the emperor and empress of Japan. Stephen Frearss film The Queen attempted to imagine what goes on inside the

title: Battle Company Is Out There
description: WE TUMBLED OUT of two Black Hawks onto a shrub-dusted mountainside. It was a windy, cold October evening. A half-moon illuminated the tall pines and peaks. Through night-vision goggles the soldiers and landscape glowed in a blurry green-and-white static. Just across the valley, lights flickered from a few homes nestled in the terraced farmlands of Yaka China, a notorious village in the Korengal River valley in Afghanistans northeastern province of Kunar. Yaka China was just a few villages south and around a bend in the river from the Americans small mountain outposts, but the areas reputation among the soldiers was mythic. It was a known safe haven for insurgents. American troops have tended to avoid the place since a nasty fight a year or so earlier. And as Halloween approached, the soldiers I was with, under the command of 26-year-old Capt. Dan Kearney, were predicting their own Yaka China doom.

title: Somber Clinton Soldiers On as the Horizon Darkens
description: To her longtime friends, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton sounds unusually philosophical on the phone these days. She rarely uses phrases like when Im president anymore. Somber at times, determined at others, she talks to aides and confidants about the importance of focusing on a good days work. No drapes are being measured in her minds eye, they say.

title: Decriminalize Sex Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: The Undecider
description: WHEN it comes to this years presidential race, Marc Baum offers, like a villanelle, two refrains: Im a lifelong Democrat and I have no idea.

title: Full Disclosure | FASHION OPENS UP.
description: Calvin Klein Collection silk organza molded dress, $1,450. Go to calvinklein.com.

title: Up on the Tightrope
description: Mental patients come in handy on stage and screen. Characters who are officially disturbed can say things like I sit still and listen. Its like praying, I think without coming off as pretentious. Or Im perking up inside. Thats where it starts without seeming painfully obvious. Or Its getting extra white in here without having to explain.

title: Out on Highway 61
description: In Search of the Blues is not about the blues, or the people who made the blues. Its about people who made the dark side of blues music into what popular mythology calls the Delta blues. Those people arent singers or players but folk song scholars and record collectors.

title: Criminal Neglect
description: To the Editor:

title: Countering Above-Average Fees
description: AS higher maintenance and common charges become the norm these days, higher-than-average monthly fees have lost some of their tendency to curdle the blood of buyers. But pricing these apartments can be more art than science.

title: American Models, Plucked From Everyday Life
description: Virginia Snedeker was a member of the American Scene movement, a group of painters of the 1920s through the 1940s who rejected avant garde modernism and chose instead to embrace social realism and the depiction of everyday life. Ms. Snedeker focused her attention on life in New York, producing paintings and drawings in addition to illustrations and covers for The New Yorker.

title: Once Immune, Utah Is Feeling Economic Dip
description: SALT LAKE CITY  In the economic boom that thundered through Utah over the last few years, many people saw a kind of perfect chemistry at work.

title: What Is Left Out
description: Robert Creeley (1926-2005) was one of the darker poets of his generation, and also one of the best. He experienced hardship early on, losing his father, and also his left eye from an accident, by the time he was 5. The death of his father, a doctor, straitened the familys circumstances. But the character of his darkness probably has more to do with New England  Hawthornes grave and dark-clad company  than anything else. Its a severity of outlook that underpins the work of Emily Dickinson and Robert Frost, as well.

title: Fashion Emergency
description: Everywhere you look  from Richard Princes kitschy Nurse portraits to Keira Knightleys wartime angel of mercy in Atonement to the white-suited vixens in recent videos for Duran Duran and Good Charlotte  Florence Nightingale and friends are having a moment. Not since Catherine Barkley, the love interest in A Farewell to Arms, achieved literary immortality wearing what seemed to me to be a nurses uniform has the peaked-capped protector generated so much cultural traction.

title: Peeking Inside the Mind of the Boy Dating Your Daughter
description: THE image of the testosterone-fueled teenage boy is a familiar one. It has been reinforced by movies such as Porkys, American Pie and Superbad, which chronicle the escapades of high school boys determined to lose their virginity.

title: A Detour to Homeownership
description: IT took Enrico Gomez and Kevin Moore a long time to prepare for homeownership. Four or five years ago, when interest rates sank to historic lows, everyone at work began talking about buying a home, Mr. Gomez said. So he and Mr. Moore began talking about it, too.

title: Citywide Scissors, Bloodletting in the Neighborhood
description: AT Public School 308 in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, mornings officially begin with an address to teachers and students by the schools tall and commanding principal, Gail Bell-Baptiste.

title: A Precincts Hard Road Back
description: Nine blocks from where Sean Bell was shot and a few hours after three detectives go on trial in his death, the mournful notes of a bagpipe will mark another moment when a Queens neighborhood was filled with the staccato of gunfire.

title: Immigrant Artists
description: To the Editor:

title: Ambiguities
description: I want a swift and hard cleanup out there. I want this kidnapping wave stopped. I want all this molesting of young children by perverts stamped out. I want housebreaking cleaned up. I want the streets of Brentwood Park so calm that a 6-year-old girl can roll her hoop down the main street without fear, singing her little nursery song. ... Can you do that for me, Ruddy?

title: Letter: Breaking Through
description: Having greatly enjoyed the film Juno, I was delighted to see Ryan McGinleys photograph of Ellen Page on the cover of the Feb. 10 magazine. I read with interest Lynn Hirschbergs description of Page as a tomboy. It is unfortunate that we have no other word available to describe this strong, independent young woman than to refer to her as a tomboy. This continues to convey to girls that growing up clear-eyed and courageous is being like a boy.

title: Can a Sponsors Tenant Be Evicted in Queens?
description: Q For the last 18 months Ive been renting an apartment in a Queens co-op that was converted in 1987. I just received an eviction letter because the buildings sponsor is selling the rental apartments. I dont want to buy. Do they have the legal right to evict me?

title: The Talk
description: dishabille / (dis& e be\l) / n. / (From the French dshabiller, to undress.) The state of being partially or very casually dressed, as in, The teen star gives an extremely naked performance in the CW remake of Bilitis, spending the entire movie in varying degrees of dishabille; a front-row buzzword in a season in which designers have stripped back the silhouette to its conceptual, neoburlesque bare bones, e.g., The collection was very mid-90s Madonna dishabille in Seville meets Dita Von Teese in Greece.

title: Life Imitating Film
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Dress Me Up, Dress Me Down
description: Excuse me while I slip into something more comfortable.

title: What That McCain Article Didnt Say
description: BILL KELLER, the executive editor of The Times, said the article about John McCain that appeared in Thursdays paper was about a man nearly felled by scandal who rebuilt himself as a fighter against corruption but is still careless about appearances, careless about his reputation, and thats a pretty important thing to know about somebody who wants to be president of the United States.

title: Friends, Romans, Countrymen, Lend Me Your Speech
description: ON Feb. 9, 1950, Senator Joseph McCarthy claimed his place in the history books by telling a crowd in Wheeling, W.Va., that the State Department was full of Communists. We are not dealing with spies who get 30 pieces of silver to steal the blueprint of a new weapon, he said. We are dealing with a far more sinister type of activity because it permits the enemy to guide and shape our policy. The claim was baseless, scurrilous  and plagiarized. The same words, practically verbatim, had been spoken on the floor of the House of Representatives two weeks earlier, by Representative Richard M. Nixon of California.

title: Enticing Theatergoers to Make Travel Plans
description: NEW YORKERS sometimes admit this only grudgingly, but there is a world beyond Manhattan, and this spring the rest of the country will yield some interesting theater, over and above the usual assortment of revivals and star vehicles.

title: Recalling Romance, Brazilian Rock Beats and an Age-Old Harp
description: Whats Happening in Pernambuco?

title: Bar Babies
description: Bar Babies

title: On Center Stage, a Candidate Letting His Confidence Show
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Barack Obama has a Barcalounger manner about him these days, padding about those campaign stages like a man commanding his den.

title: Inside the List
description: 25 YEARS AGO: The advice, how-to and miscellaneous lists first appeared in the Book Review early in 1984. Before this catchall category existed, advice best sellers were placed on the general nonfiction list, where they crowded out almost everything else. See the list below, for example, which ran 25 years ago, on Feb. 20, 1983. Of the 10 books printed here, only three  Andy Rooneys, William Least Heat Moons and Russell Bakers  would qualify for the general list today. Jane Fondas Workout Book, by the way, spent more than half a year at No. 1 and more than 16 months in the top five.

title: Unless You Have Another Word, Dance Will Do
description: LONDON

title: Ballyhoo
description: In the latest fashion makeover, the staid Swiss shoemaker Bally has emerged from

title: Calling All Rock Stars in Aprons
description: MIAMI

title: 36 Hours in Mont Tremblant, Quebec
description: FOR an East Coast ski resort, Mont Tremblant seems to have it all. Combining the Canadian charm of a rustic logging town with the Old World flavor of the French Alps, Tremblant is consistently ranked by Ski Magazine readers as the Easts No. 1 resort. Theres been only one problem: getting there required an hours-long slog from Montreal through the boondocks of Quebec. But all that changed this winter. Continental started offering direct flights to Mont Tremblant from Newark, making it possible for morning commuters from New York to stroll its faux-European base village by midafternoon. Things will get even nicer, when a new village (with 21,000-square-foot casino) and gondola open up some time later this year.

title: Letters: Father and Sons
description: I admire the three sons for their willingness to donate a kidney to their aging father (The Ethicist, Feb. 10). But the issue that I believe is even more at the crux of the ethical matter is that of an aging father asking, or even accepting, the offer by his children to donate a kidney. As a 68-year-old father who recently had a kidney removed, I would not even contemplate accepting such an offer from my children if I were to lose my remaining kidney. Jeopardizing my childrens future well-being in exchange for a few more years of my own life would just not be worth it.

title: Anterior Motives
description: On a recent Friday morning in Los Angeles, a handful of eager women sat on sofas in the Sunset Boulevard offices of Dr. David Matlock noshing on bagels and cream cheese. Dr. Matlock, who made his name performing liposuction and then transplanting the fat to create a Brazilian butt augmentation, and who later went on to have a role on the reality show Dr. 90210, patiently explained the ins and outs of the injectible procedure of the moment, one that he claims to have invented and that makes Botox seem so five wrinkles ago.

title: With Open Adoption, a New Kind of Family
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J.

title: A Second Wind for a Professional Oaf
description: ENCINO, Calif.

title: And Liberty for All
description: The sensuality of William Morris is alive and well, thanks to Tamara Salmans new prints for Liberty of London.

title: Datebook
description: REYKJAVIK

title: Out of Kisumu
description: We should have seen it coming. The violence between the Luo and the Kikuyu tribes that started after the December elections was spreading again down Kenyas Rift Valley. By Sunday evening, there was news that 19 people, including women and children, all Luos, had been burned in a house in Naivasha. But by Monday morning in Kisumu, the Luo-dominated city in western Kenya, everybody went about business normally.

title: Maybe Microsoft Should Stalk Different Prey
description: OVER the years, Microsoft has pummeled countless rivals, including the superheavyweight I.B.M. But it has never faced a smaller foe as formidable as Google. The tale of the tape gives Microsoft a $100 billion advantage in market capitalization, but it counts for little: Google appears to be its superior in strength, speed, smarts.

title: Police Seek Help in Criminal Deportation
description: LAST summer the Suffern police arrested a 17-year-old illegal immigrant after he was found peeping into a girls bathroom at the village recreation center.

title: Governors of Both Parties Oppose Medicaid Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Governors of both parties strongly objected on Saturday to a half-dozen new federal Medicaid regulations that they said would shift billions of dollars in costs to the states, forcing them to consider cutbacks in services.

title: The Roitfelds | Family de la Mode
description: Carine Roitfeld, the editor in chief of Vogue Paris, bequeathed her children her soign style as if it were their birthright. Her daughter, Julia Restoin-Roitfeld, is a freelance art director for the likes of Jean Paul Gaultier and was the face of Tom Fords latest fragrance; her son, Vladimir Restoin-Roitfeld, is a film school graduate and a sometime model. Going to a fashion shoot when they were young, says Mom, was as normal as tarte Tatin. (The photographer Mario Testino is their godfather.) Many consider Roitfeld the stilettoed embodiment of modern dressing: she describes her style as tacky chic. Never afraid to take a risk, she has put a bearded drag queen on a cover and printed a fashion story with a model dressed as an Anna Wintour clone. After 20-plus years in the business, certain things have changed: I dont go too much to the parties now, but my kids do. Like their mom, theyre always on the list. [?][?][?]ALEX HAWGOOD

title: Insurance Fears Lead Many to Shun DNA Tests
Finding New Life in the Arts
description: FOR centuries, the northwest corner of old Bologna was an industrial zone, home to slaughterhouses, salt works and tobacco factories. But now the once neglected neighborhood, a 15-minute walk from the city center, is churning out a new commodity: art.

title: Philandering Father
description: Are the heroes of picaresque the blondes of literature? They certainly have more fun. Theyre never stuck at home on a Saturday night. Theyre never stuck at home, period. Dubious company becomes them. We count on them for brazen behavior, the more so as its their job to expose the rotten planks of society, the underside of human nature. If theyre not conning someone into whitewashing the fence, they can be found cozying up to the wrong woman. To their ranks, the two Toms, Sawyer and Jones, may welcome Johnny One-Eye, Jerome Charyns newest brainchild.

title: Letters: Cybercourting
description: Laurie Kasparians Feb. 10 Lives column was one of the most romantic pieces of writing Ive ever encountered. Thank you for an early Valentines Day treat.

title: Prospect for N.F.L. First Ran From Liberia
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Each evening at the N.F.L. scouting combine, Jehuu Caulcrick sits in a chair across from N.F.L. coaches and executives. They ask about Michigan State, where he played football. They ask about the small western New York farm town where he grew up.

title: Profile in Style: Chloe Sevigny
description: HER POSSE: Chlo Sevigny says her friends and family have influenced both her career and her style. Her mother, Janine, would chauffeur her from Darien, Conn., to Manhattan for auditions; her moms pal even snapped some of Sevignys first head shots. She credits her brother Paul, a D.J., for her early punk sensibilities: I was obsessed with the different hair colors of all his girlfriends. The designer Benjamin Cho meticulously drew her 30th-birthday invitation, and she even wrangled her girlfriends to model for a showing of her new clothing line with Opening Ceremony. All my friends are insane, but Im actually quite normal, she says. I think they are attracted to my sanity. her 30th-birthday invite. right: with the designers of proenza schouler.

title: Late-Night Diplomat for Bilingual Viewers
description: LOS ANGELES

title: IN  STORE | China Shop
description: 1. Sarah Rutson doesnt take no for an answer. The fashion director of Lane Crawford, a bevy of luxe boutiques in Hong Kong and Beijing, digs her Louboutin heels in when it comes to the designers and trends she believes in: I wont shut up until the order is written! Here she wears a dress by Roland Mouret.

title: Birds Do It. Bees Do It. Dragons Dont Need To.
description: Chicago

title: Correction: Is PBS Still Necessary?
description: Because of an editing error, an article last Sunday about the state of public broadcasting misstated the former position of Kenneth Y. Tomlinson, who encouraged public-television stations to broadcast a program whose host was Paul Gigot, editor of The Wall Street Journals editorial page. Mr. Tomlinson was chairman of the board of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting; he was not chairman of PBS.

title: Correction: Curves in the Road to Redeeming Miles
description: The Practical Traveler column on Feb. 10 about redeeming frequent flier miles misstated the cut-off date for an American Airlines award for tickets between New York and London that cost only 40,000 miles; the offer is through May 15, not June 15.

title: At 31, Robinson Says Breaking Record in 800 Is Only One Goal
description: BOSTON  Khadevis Robinson is the United States most productive 800-meter runner since Johnny Gray in the 1980s and 1990s. Grays career seemed to last forever, including an Olympic final at 36, but he sees greater glory for Robinson, which makes generous sense. He coaches him.

title: Now Printing | Cecil Beaton
description: Cecil Beaton possessed a keen eye for all things fashionable. While he found his mtier as a portrait photographer, he also played the role of dandy, diarist, Oscar-winning costumer and, oddly enough, fabric designer. Now, through the London interior design company Beaudesert and the archives of Ascher Studio, reproductions of Beatons checks, florals and stripes are being sold at Liberty of London. The Cecil Beaton fabric collection  on silk, cotton, linen and wallpaper  was inspired by a scarf that Beaudeserts managing director, Andrew Ginger, found on eBay; Beaton had originally designed it for the textile firm Ascher. In the 1940s and early 50s, Zika Ascher commissioned artists such as Henri Matisse and Henry Moore to design fabrics, paying them 25 per motif, according to his son, Peter. All the big designers, like Balenciaga, Givenchy, Lanvin and Yves Saint Laurent, would buy their fabrics from Ascher Studio. Although not known for his brush strokes, Beaton was an obvious choice for fabric, and Zika allowed him free rein. An artist with a color sense is not someone you mess with, Zika has been quoted as saying. The timing couldnt be better, as this springs runways were full of blossoms. Cant you just see the Beaton bouquet on your fainting couch? [?][?][?]MELISSA FELDMAN

title: World Food Without Leaving the Neighborhood
description: GROCERY stores in other countries have long been a stealth tourist attraction for travelers. The format is familiar  aisles, shopping carts and screaming children  but the food is anything but, ranging from the exotic to the merely intriguing. And then you turn the corner and see the familiar face of Tony the Tiger hawking a strangely-renamed product (Frosties, Zucaritas, Sucrilhos), bringing perhaps a pang of cultural imperialist guilt.

title: Events on Long Island
description: FILM

title: Late Stand by Lundqvist Boosts the Rangers
description: BUFFALO  As Buffalo forward Thomas Vanek skated in on Rangers goalie Henrik Lundqvist late in a tie game that the Rangers needed so desperately to win Saturday night, it seemed as if the Rangers entire season could hang on the moment.

title: Correction: So Who Wins the Big Prize? Its the Host
description: An article last Sunday about The Price Is Right referred imprecisely to the prize featured in a new version of the show that CBS began broadcasting on Friday during prime time. In The Price Is Right Million-Dollar Spectacular, contestants have chances to win $1 million in cash, not a showcase of prizes worth $1 million.

title: Raisin in the Sun: Another First
description: To the Editor:

title: The Skies Are Alive With Fees
description: THE low-fare European carrier Ryanair is the world champion among airlines in generating extra cash by charging customers fees for services and products that most airlines include in the ticket price: checked bags, beverages and  for a time before the idea was dropped amid public outcry  even using a wheelchair.

title: The Pond, the Murals. Oh, and Theres Food.
description: FROM its unusual name and dramatically illuminated facade to its theatrical interior, BOE@324 Restaurant is so distractingly elaborate that whats on the menu almost becomes a vague afterthought.

title: Nets Find Scoring Help Up and Down Lineup
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Maybe the Nets will not miss Jason Kidd after all. They won for the second time in three games since trading Kidd to Dallas, defeating the Indiana Pacers, 102-91, on Saturday with some familiar and unexpected names leading the way.

title: A Fire in the Heart
description: We all live in the shadow of history, and the play of its lights and shades over individual lives is the stuff of historical fiction. In his sweepingly ambitious, captivating second novel, The Age of Shiva, Manil Suri creates a woman who is never an actor in the great events of Indias post-independence decades but cannot escape their power to shape her.

title: For Out-of-Towners, the Race Is to the Sleepless
description: LOS ANGELES

title: A Place to Park That Million-Dollar RV
description: About 8.3 million American households currently own an RV, according to the Recreation Vehicle Industry Association. It seems only fitting that the luxury RV crowd  some of whom may have paid upwards of $2 million to purchase their mobile homes prefer lots a bit spiffier than your average roadside campground. Although private gated communities for RVs exist, starting this spring the country will have its first national chain. Called Bella Terra (www.bellaterrarvresort.com), the chain will open its first resort, above, in Gulf Shores, Ala. The property will include a clubhouse, pools, a childrens water play area, a movie theater, a lake stocked for fishing and business and fitness centers. Nightly rates will be about $100; those interested in purchasing lots will be able to do so for a starting price of $100,000. The chain is expected to develop five more properties within the next 38 to 46 months.

title: Never the Twain Shall Meet
description: I COULD not get East Side, West Side, all around the town  lyrics from the classic Sidewalks of New York  out of my mind after visiting two buildings on opposite sides of Central Park. The Laurel is a 31-story condominium going up on East 67th Street, at First Avenue. And 610 West 110th Street is a 15-floor prewar building being renovated at that address, between Broadway and Riverside Drive.

title: Editors Choice
description: THE LAST FLIGHT OF THE SCARLET MACAW: One Womans Fight to Save the Worlds Most Beautiful Bird, by Bruce Barcott. (Random House, $26.) A bitter legal battle over a river valley in Belize is waged in a steamy climate of corruption and intrigue.

title: Emily Stein, Benjamin Lupin
description: Dr. Emily Caren Stein, a daughter of Billie Stein and Dr. Marc Stein of Vineland, N.J., was married on Saturday evening to Benjamin Scott Lupin, the son of Linda S. Lupin and Steven H. Lupin of Blue Bell, Pa. Rabbi Gregory S. Marx officiated at the Philadelphia Marriott Downtown.

title: 40 Killed in Blast Amid Crowd of Shiites in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  A suicide bomber detonated amid a crowd of Shiites making a pilgrimage to the Shrine of Imam Husayn in Karbila, Sunday, killing at least 40 people and injuring more than 100.

title: Amsterdam Tries Upscale Fix for Red-Light District Crime
description: AMSTERDAM  Some of the most visited brothels in Amsterdams red-light district have gained unexpected new neighbors.

title: Are Oscars Worth All This Fuss?
description: THERE is something of a consensus among critics  a disagreeable bunch, it should be noted  that 2007 was one of the best years for movies, American movies in particular, in recent memory. As a result the leading contenders for major Oscars have unusually solid aesthetic bona fides. Of course there are those who grouse about the endings of There Will Be Blood and No Country for Old Men, who find Juno more grating than charming, who were baffled by Michael Clayton or who were bored by Atonement, but all in all it looks like an impressively strong field. Meanwhile the Writers Guild strike, which had threatened to encircle the Kodak Theater with picket lines and bury the Academy Awards in bad feelings, has been settled. The show will go on  Sunday night at 8  and everybodys happy.

title: A Big Year for a Full-Service Composer
description: AS an applicant to the composition program at the Paris Conservatoire in 1960, the Seattle native William Bolcom churned out his regulation fugue and sonata movement on cue. But asked to present what he was working on, he offered One Little Bomb and Boom!, a jaunty waltz from his cabaret opera Dynamite Tonight, modeled on novelty numbers from the time of World War I. The lyric was by the New York poet Arnold Weinstein, who blended classical learning and jive with wicked panache.

title: Lisa Sigloch, Mark Markowski
description: Lisa Montagu Sigloch and Mark Paul Markowski were married on Wednesday at the New York City Municipal Building. Blanca Martinez, a staff member at the office of the city clerk, officiated. The couple had another ceremony on Feb. 2 at the Ceiba del Mar Beach and Spa Resort in Puerto Morelos, Mexico, at which the Rev. Enrique Monroy, a Catholic priest gave a blessing.

title: Neighbor vs. Neighbor
description: A report in the Big Deal column last Sunday about lawyers who sue their neighbors in apartment buildings misstated the circumstances under which lawyers can be refused housing in New York City. Although a 1977 court decision upheld a landlords right to refuse to rent to a lawyer, the citys human rights law was amended in 1986 to bar discrimination in housing on the basis of a lawful occupation. Co-op and condominium boards may, however, reject lawyers and other applicants based on specific actions  for instance, a pattern of filing lawsuits against neighbors.

title: Lemon Zest
description: ON a cold morning late last month, I took a subway to Union Square Park to see a bird I had never seen. The bird, a Scotts oriole, had been noted intermittently behind the statue of Mohandas Gandhi since December, though it took birders several weeks to figure out that it was not in fact an orchard oriole  which would have been unusual enough for winter in Manhattan. Scotts oriole is a bird of the Southwest and has never been recorded in New York. It should be no farther east than Texas, which is why, despite my sluggardly winter ways, I decided it was worth a trip down from the Upper West Side, where I live.

title: Peeking Inside the Mind of the Boy Dating Your Daughter
description: THE image of the testosterone-fueled teenage boy is a familiar one. It has been reinforced by movies such as Porkys, American Pie and Superbad, which chronicle the escapades of high school boys determined to lose their virginity.

title: Georgia Peach
description: STYLE MAP | SAVANNAH In the 1997 film Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil, a New York writer visiting Savannah, Ga., describes the town as  Gone With the Wind on mescaline. Its easy to see what he meant: the Spanish-moss-draped streets are lined with stately Southern homes, barbecue joints and dusky bars. Recently, however, a little cool has been injected into the antebellum mix, with style-savvy design students, smartly restored inns and a handful of trendy new shops. [?][?][?]ARMAND LIMNANDER

title: The Battle Over the Greens
description: PERHAPS more than any other civic rivals, street vendors and brick-and-mortar stores seem to play a zero-sum game. The stores are wary of the vendors, whom they see as nimble nuisances undercutting their prices, unfettered by regulation or rent. The vendors see the stores as competition-hating Goliaths.

title: Maiden Voyage
description: The shipping news? Brash prints and bold lengths.

title: No Longer an Afterthought
description: Specializing in seafood and other dishes in the Cantonese style, Aberdeen in White Plains is one of the countys few regional Chinese restaurants holding out against the recent Pan-Asian invasion. Dishes of Canton reflect the regions mild climate and its position on the South China Sea, where a full supply of fish, meats, fruits and vegetables available throughout the year has helped establish Cantons reputation for producing Chinas most varied, creative and savory dishes.

title: The Color Purple | ITS the ROYAL HUE
description: To get a modern stained lip, Page blended two lipsticks on the back of his hand: a Bordeaux cream, like M.A.C. Media, and a fuchsia cream, like Nars Funny Face. Then he used his fingertip to blot it onto the lips.

title: The Sound and the Fhrer
description: Among the many acid pleasures of the work of Roberto Bolao, who died at 50 in 2003, is his idea that culture, in particular literary culture, is a whore. In the face of political repression, upheaval and danger, writers continue to swoon over the written word, and this, for Bolao, is the source both of nobility and of pitch-black humor. In his novel The Savage Detectives, two avid young Latino poets never lose faith in their rarefied art no matter the vicissitudes of life, age and politics. If they are sometimes ridiculous, they are always heroic. But what can it mean, he asks us and himself, in his dark, extraordinary, stinging novella By Night in Chile, that the intellectual elite can write poetry, paint and discuss the finer points of avant-garde theater as the junta tortures people in basements? The word has no national loyalty, no fundamental political bent; its a genie that can be summoned by any would-be master. Part of Bolaos genius is to ask, via ironies so sharp you can cut your hands on his pages, if we perhaps find a too-easy comfort in art, if we use it as anesthetic, excuse and hide-out in a world that is very busy doing very real things to very real human beings. Is it courageous to read Plato during a military coup or is it something else?

title: Crisis Management
description: A writer, Eudora Welty insisted, must know her characters hearts and minds before they ever set visible foot on stage. You must know all, then not tell it all, or not tell too much at once: simply the right thing at the right moment. When fiction doles out its revelations in this way  when it allows just the right sequence of glimpses through a parted curtain  we misleadingly call it realistic. Actual existence is rarely well choreographed.

title: Miho Walsh and Roy Prieb
description: IT started with shrimp dumplings.

title: Testing Your Water for Contaminants
description: MOST homeowners, particularly those who get their water from private wells, are curious or concerned about the quality of their water.

title: High School Player With Down Syndrome Shoots, and Scores
description: MEDFORD

title: The Audacity of Hopelessness
description: WHEN people one day look back at the remarkable implosion of the Hillary Clinton campaign, they may notice that it both began and ended in the long dark shadow of Iraq.

title: Correction: There Will Be Memories
description: A chart last Sunday showing highlights of Oscar telecasts over the last 54 years misidentified the actress who in 1953 sang Thumbelina to her thumb. She is Celeste Holm, not Ginger Rogers.

title: Memories of a C.I.A. Officer Resonate in a New Era
description: LOCUST GROVE, Va.  Larry Devlin is 85 now, suffering from emphysema and tethered to an oxygen tank, his Central Intelligence Agency career long behind him. But he recalls with sunlit clarity the day in Congo nearly half a century ago when he was handed a packet of poisons, including toxic toothpaste, and ordered to carry out a political assassination.

title: Seeing the City by the Bay, Affordably
description: Top reader suggestions on San Francisco, compiled from user comments posted on the Travel sections Web site. You can read more comments, as well as add your own, at nytimes.com/travel.

title: Italy Wide and Varied, Warm and Intimate
